title: Bozić
text: Bozić in <a href="Slavic%20paganism">Slavic paganism</a> is a creature symbolizing the <a href="New%20Year">New Year</a>, <a href="Spring%20%28season%29">spring</a> and youth. It appears in <a href="Christmas">Christmas</a> customs accompanied by a golden-horned deer and a pig, as opposed to <a href="Badnjak%20%28Serbian%29">Badnjak</a>. In the languages of the <a href="South%20Slavs">South Slavs</a>, the word was transferred to the modern name of Christmas, e.g. <a href="Serbian%20language">Serbian</a> Божић, Croatian Božić. The figure of Bozić is probably an echo of the cult of <a href="Svarog">Svarog</a>. Bozić is the personification of the sun, which allegedly dies and is born every year (similar to the ancient Roman oriental cult of <a href="Sol%20Invictus">Sol Invictus</a>). Features of the cult of Christmas are transferred to the Christian religion: the <a href="Serbs">Serbs</a>, <a href="Croats">Croats</a>, <a href="Slovenes">Slovenes</a> call the holiday "Christmas" <a href="Jesus">Christ</a> "Christmas", the <a href="Bulgarians">Bulgarians</a> - "Christmas".
